title: Changes Ahead as NASA’s Human Spaceflight Head Plans Retirement
summary: Kathryn Lueders, associate administrator of NASA’s Space Operations Mission Directorate, announced Monday she will retire from the agency at the end of April. Lueders’ current deputy and astronaut, Ken Bowersox, will become the new head of Space Operations, effective Monday, May 1.

title: Blue Origin provides a detailed analysis of its launch failure
summary: The company says it intends to return to flight "soon."

title: Inflation, high demand driving up launch prices
summary: A tight launch market, coupled with high inflation, has driven up launch prices in the last year, putting a squeeze on customers.

title: Remote sensing companies try to capture bigger piece of satellite imaging market
summary: Maxar, Planet and BlackSky are working to expand their offerings beyond optical imagery.

title: ABL Space Secures $60M USSF/USAF Demo Contract
summary: ABL Space Systems has secured a $60 million contract from the US Space Force and US Air Force.
